snippet.textDisplay: To anyone who says that Louis just had the best car, well one it takes the best car to win the championship. Two, you don't win 6 world titles with pure luck. Michael Schumacher won 7 championships because he was the best driver in the best car. I think the same applies to Hamilton. And this is coming from a person with a Ferrari flag on his wall. You don't have to be a fan of him to respect his greatness.
snippet.textOriginal: To anyone who says that Louis just had the best car, well one it takes the best car to win the championship. Two, you don't win 6 world titles with pure luck. You don't have to be a fan of him to respect his greatness.

snippet.textDisplay:
The Goal in sight now, you don't switch Horses in mid stream, stick with what you have and get the record for most Championships ever....then put that behind you and move on to the next page in your story. I have a good feeling your story is a long long way from.......The End.
Senna was the Greatest of all time , like him or not the guy was a Shooting Star, Schumacher has the Most Championships of all time and was a cold calculating driver almost worthy of the Raikkonen "Iceman" moniker.....but Lewis has no equal in racing as of yet anyhow.....I wonder how History will remember him ?......
snippet.textOriginal:

Senna was the Greatest of all time , like him or not the guy was a Shooting Star, Schumacher has the Most Championships of all time and was a cold calculating driver almost worthy of the Raikkonen "Iceman" moniker.....but Lewis has no equal in racing as of yet anyhow.....I wonder how History will remember him ?......

snippet.textDisplay:
It’s been such an honour to see this man grow and flourish over the years, especially under Mercedes. While I do think close competition is essential for F1, a part of me really does wish that he can break Schumacher’s records with Merc, and then bow out of the sport truly the greatest there ever was.

There is something magical about the Lewis/Merc combination that inspires greatness. You can’t help but appreciate the hard work and sacrifice that goes into staying on top for so, so long. Roll on 2020 👊🏼✌🏼
snippet.textOriginal:
It’s been such an honour to see this man grow and flourish over the years, especially under Mercedes. While I do think close competition is essential for F1, a part of me really does wish that he can break Schumacher’s records with Merc, and then bow out of the sport truly the greatest there ever was. 

There is something magical about the Lewis/Merc combination that inspires greatness. You can’t help but appreciate the hard work and sacrifice that goes into staying on top for so, so long. Roll on 2020 👊🏼✌🏼

snippet.textDisplay: I've been a Lewis fan since Oz 07 driving around the outside of Alonso into turn 1. Right then and there you could see he was destined to be world champion but 6 of them wow. As a lifelong motorsports fan from the UK thank you to Lewis for giving me a home driver to support and someone so worthwhile to cheer for and to Mercedes for giving him the amazing cars they have to do it in. Now make it a 7th in 2020!
snippet.textOriginal: I've been a Lewis fan since Oz 07 driving around the outside of Alonso into turn 1. Right then and there you could see he was destined to be world champion but 6 of them wow. snippet.textDisplay: I really hope in 2020 the season will be more competitive and exciting to watch exactly how the 2nd half of the the 2019 season went when Ferrari and Redbull started putting up a fight with Charles Leclar and Max verstappen winning races.. I hope in the 2020 season we can continue to see Charles being a front runner and winning races cuz he's starting to be my favorite f1 driver and would also like to see Max and even Seb to put up a fight against Mercedes and hopefully have a new champion other than a Mercedes driver don't get me wrong i like and respect what lewis has been able to accomplish but it's also nice to shake things up and have exciting races where u don't know who will win the race every week

snippet.textDisplay: I found Formula 1 on accident. I have always difficulty falling asleep and staying asleep. I would turn on the TV when I would wake up in the middle of the night and it would help me fall back to sleep. It was around 3 am here in  America where I live. The race had already started and I thought, I'll watch this and I am sure I will fall asleep. I ended up watching the entire race and so it began. That was well over a decade ago.
snippet.textOriginal: I found Formula 1 on accident. I have always difficulty falling asleep and staying asleep. I would turn on the TV when I would wake up in the middle of the night and it would help me fall back to sleep. It was around 3 am here in  America where I live. The race had already started and I thought, I'll watch this and I am sure I will fall asleep. I ended up watching the entire race and so it began. That was well over a decade ago.

snippet.textDisplay: Mercedes might be dominant, but people need to understand that they wouldn't be dominant without Louis. He is the key to their success. They couldn't do it with Nico and Michael before him. Michael was just as important to Ferrari's success. They couldn't win a championship before Michael and only won one after him. Yes, both teams were dominant, but they were dominant on the shoulders of perhaps the two best drivers in the history of the sport. There are examples of drivers that weren't the best but won a championship because of a totally dominant car, but Lewis certainly isn't one of those.
snippet.textOriginal: Mercedes might be dominant, but people need to understand that they wouldn't be dominant without Louis. He is the key to their success. They couldn't do it with Nico and Michael before him. Michael was just as important to Ferrari's success. They couldn't win a championship before Michael and only won one after him. Yes, both teams were dominant, but they were dominant on the shoulders of perhaps the two best drivers in the history of the sport. There are examples of drivers that weren't the best but won a championship because of a totally dominant car, but Lewis certainly isn't one of those.

snippet.textDisplay: He is the best, nearly won in his rookie season in 2007, won on the last corner in 2008 in a era where mclaren and Ferrari were equal, then he had 5 years of still winning races and pole positions, still doing great overtakes and comebacks and was always exciting to watch but result had the meat aerodynamics and ferrari had the pace, and he suffered from reliability issues lots of retirements in this period, in 2013 he joined Mercedes and beat rosberg and rosberg had consistently beat an ageing Schumacher , then in 2014 he got the best car and proved how good he is, and since then he only lost in 1 season to rosberg by 5 points but still managed to end the season with 10 wins to rosbergs 9,  I would love to see vettel and Hamilton in the same team before they retire
snippet.textOriginal: He is the best, nearly won in his rookie season in 2007, won on the last corner in 2008 in a era where mclaren and Ferrari were equal, then he had 5 years of still winning races and pole positions, still doing great overtakes and comebacks and was always exciting to watch but result had the meat aerodynamics and ferrari had the pace, and he suffered from reliability issues lots of retirements in this period, in 2013 he joined Mercedes and beat rosberg and rosberg had consistently beat an ageing Schumacher , then in 2014 he got the best car and proved how good he is, and since then he only lost in 1 season to rosberg by 5 points but still managed to end the season with 10 wins to rosbergs 9,  I would love to see vettel and Hamilton in the same team before they retire

snippet.textDisplay: The most boring & fake personality in F1, only idiots will fall for that. The sooner he leave F1 the better and less boring racing will be...

snippet.textDisplay: I am a Ferrari and Charles Leclerc fan but man Hamilton is such a great driver. It’s true some times is boring to see him wining so much but he wins so much because of his talent , the hard work from him and the great that is Mercedes and his fighter soul. I got to say that as a young guy he is a big inspiration for me. I can’t wait to see Charles and Lewis fighting next year for the championship. Lewis you are a great champ and one of the best drivers in history no matter what car you drive.
snippet.textOriginal: I am a Ferrari and Charles Leclerc fan but man Hamilton is such a great driver. snippet.textDisplay: I have always been a Ferrari Fan. I loved Ayrton and Michael. I did not like Lewis that much, especially when he took away the 2008 Championship from Felipe. But there is no doubt he is the best these days. It is not only his Driving/competition skills, he has evolved as a person. He is truly a true model for young people. I wish he comes to drive la Rossa. I can't wait to see Charles and Lewis fighting against each other with the same car. It would make both better and better.
snippet.textOriginal: I have always been a Ferrari Fan. I loved Ayrton and Michael. I did not like Lewis that much, especially when he took away the 2008 Championship from Felipe. But there is no doubt he is the best these days. It is not only his Driving/competition skills, he has evolved as a person. He is truly a true model for young people. I wish he comes to drive la Rossa. I can't wait to see Charles and Lewis fighting against each other with the same car. It would make both better and better.

snippet.textDisplay: I wish I was this driven.  I'd be CEO in the next few years.  Lewis Hamilton epitomizes hard graft and when he reaps the rewards, people hate him instead learning from him. snippet.textDisplay: Lewis is The People's Champ... a world class athlete. World class champion. As a new F1 fan, it can get boring to see him win so often. But in the right perspective, we're in the midst of being able to watch the greatest to ever do it in the pinnacle of motorsports as he caps off a career the likes of which we've never seen before and may never see again. Bravo, Lewis.... thanks for being you.
snippet.textOriginal: Lewis is The People's Champ... a world class athlete. World class champion. As a new F1 fan, it can get boring to see him win so often. But in the right perspective, we're in the midst of being able to watch the greatest to ever do it in the pinnacle of motorsports as he caps off a career the likes of which we've never seen before and may never see again. Bravo, Lewis.... thanks for being you.
